title: A true character of sundry trades and callings: or, A new ditty of innocent mirth. This song is new, and perfect true, there's none can this deny; for I am known, friend, to be one that scorns to tell a lye. To the tune of, Old Simon the King. This may be printed, R.P.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, at the Golden-Ball in Pye-corner.,
